project.title: AKASHA Hub Barcelona
project.description:
**Interdisciplinary. Independent. Self-financing.** 

**Created by CITIZENS for CITIZENS**

Since 2017 we have co-created communities and projects for social change. 

We are civil society, physical space and community, a non-profit organization that promote, host and develops sustainable projects, tools and solutions to improve society.

![Evolution!](https://akasha.barcelona/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/AKASHA-Hub-Evolution.png)

Actually we are 60 residents and more than 1000 members around the world. We have  2 warehouses in the Clot district (Barcelona) dedicated to  activities, events, knowledge transfer, workshops, urban garden, co-creation, prototyping, critical thinking and experimentation. Also we host interdisciplinary projects of social innovation, from ecology, food, to the arts, science and technopolitics or blockchain technology.

![Events/Workshops/Porjects!](https://akasha.barcelona/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/projects.png)

We believe in citizen participation and in their responsibility to collaborate and contribute ideas and solutions for social change with an impact on nearby environments, such as the neighborhood and the city.  "Culture of new forms of activism, social and civic engagement".

![Activities!](https://akasha.barcelona/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/varios.png)

![Events!](https://akasha.barcelona/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/evento2.jpg)

![Events!](https://akasha.barcelona/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/eventos.jpg)


**Our Goals for 2025-2026**
- Connect with more spaces and communities around the world 
- Host and Co-create more social innovation projects and work new co-collaborations in Real Life
- Share our vision... Globally
- Propose educational programs for the promotion of **Citizen Active Culture** in schools, social centers in our neighborhood, associations, etc. throughout Barcelona and the rest of Spain. 



**How do we govern**
- We govern by circles with leader and responsables
- All the members of our governance are collaborators (without contribution, **we are all volunteers**)
- We dont have employees



**Economic Model**
- Membership Dues
- Rental of workspaces and event/activity spaces to companies and projects aligned with our vision
- Donations
- Services as consulting or mentoring 

As part of our model, we do not receive public aid. Basic expenses such as warehouse fees and utilities (electricity, water, internet) are covered by the dues of resident members who use the space for their projects.

**All funds raised go directly to the AKASHA Hub Barcelona project to continue moving forward.**




#**Our Projects**


**Green City Lab :**  
is an open and collaborative project, promoted through AKASHA Hub Barcelona, which incorporates citizen initiative and community action, born as a response to the need to transform an obsolete city model and drive and promote a transition towards a life based on the criteria of environmental regeneration. 

We facilitate the necessary channels and manage relations with collaborating organizations and the public sector to materialize proposals at the local level in favor of the common good and the green transition of Barcelona's neighbourhoods, always within the framework of sustainable development, taking into account both environmental and social aspects and economic.

Green City Lab is a community project and Education Green Space (garden). 


![GCL!](https://akasha.barcelona/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/gcl.png)



**AKASHA FabLab :**
Space and laboratory for physical and digital prototyping and research for a social innovation projects and for citizen use for specific ideas and easy solutions. 

The projects typically developed at AKASHA Fab are related to biomaterials, design and fabrication using recycled plastic, prototyping solar cookers, fermentation ovens, and the production of raised beds for gardens or homes.


![Fab!](https://akasha.barcelona/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/AKASHA-FAB.png)



**AKASHA Cultural Program**
A cultural and educational program focused on citizen participation and civic engagement through knowledge. It explores how to apply knowledge acquired in school, university, or work to society. It makes the transfer of interdisciplinary knowledge and talents a key tool for creating solutions and ideas as citizens. From young people to seniors-elder people collectives.


![CP!](https://akasha.barcelona/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/culturalprogram_akashahub.png)


##**How to be a member ?**

AKASHA Hub Barcelona

https://buy.stripe.com/3cs5nS4dO05m53yfZ0

The membership gives access to participate in the activities organized by AKASHA and opt for special fees for the use of space. Membership does not give direct access to the use of space, for inquiries about resident fees and access rules write to:

hola@akasha.barcelona



### **Connect With Us**

Twitter → @AKASHAworldBCN

Telegram → https://t.me/+BimXDWstf680Nzk8

Instagram  → akasha.barcelona

Youtube  → @akashahubbarcelona

Mastodon  → @AKASHAHub

Email → hub@akasha.barcelona

project.title: Africycle
project.description:
AfriCycle: A Multi-Stream ReFi Waste Management Ecosystem

Summary

AfriCycle is a blockchain-powered circular economy platform built on the Celo blockchain that addresses Africa's waste management crisis across three key waste streams: plastic, electronic waste, and metal/general waste. 
The platform incentivizes waste collection through tokenized rewards, enables transparent recycling processes, and promotes corporate sustainability through verified recycling credits. 
By connecting informal waste collectors directly with recycling facilities and corporate partners, 
AfriCycle creates economic opportunities while solving environmental challenges.
Project Overview
AfriCycle represents a paradigm shift in waste management across Africa, leveraging Regenerative Finance (ReFi) principles to transform environmental challenges into economic opportunities. 
The platform serves multiple stakeholders:
Waste Collectors: Primarily informal workers who gain financial inclusion and fair compensation
Recycling Facilities: Partners who receive consistent, verified waste streams
Corporations: Entities seeking verifiable sustainability credits and recycled materials
Local Communities: Beneficiaries of cleaner environments and economic development
Problem Statement

Environmental Crisis
Africa generates approximately 17 million tons of plastic waste annually
The continent hosts the world's largest e-waste dumping grounds, with over 2.9 million tons annually
Only 4% of waste generated in Africa is currently recycled
Informal waste collection lacks standardization and verification mechanisms

Economic Challenges
Over 90% of waste in Africa is disposed of at uncontrolled dumpsites and landfills
Informal waste collectors earn less than $2 per day despite providing essential services
Financial exclusion affects 57% of Africa's population, limiting economic opportunities
Lack of transparent supply chains for recycled materials

Technological Gaps
Limited traceability in waste management systems
Absence of verification mechanisms for recycling claims
Inefficient payment systems for informal waste collectors
Disconnected stakeholders across the waste value chain

metadata.title: Africycle
metadata.description:
# **AfriCycle: A Multi-Stream ReFi Waste Management Ecosystem**

## **Summary**  
AfriCycle is a blockchain-powered circular economy platform built on the Celo blockchain, designed to tackle Africa's waste management crisis. The platform addresses three major waste streams: plastic, electronic waste (e-waste), and metal/general waste. AfriCycle incentivizes waste collection through tokenized rewards, ensures transparent recycling processes, and promotes corporate sustainability through verified recycling credits. By connecting informal waste collectors directly with recycling facilities and corporate partners, AfriCycle creates economic opportunities while solving environmental challenges.
---
## **Project Overview**  
AfriCycle represents a transformative shift in Africa’s waste management landscape, using Regenerative Finance (ReFi) principles to turn environmental challenges into economic opportunities. The platform benefits multiple stakeholders and creates a sustainable ecosystem for waste management across Africa.

### **Key Stakeholders**  
- **Waste Collectors**: Informal workers gaining financial inclusion and fair compensation 
- **Recycling Facilities**: Partners who receive*consistent, verified waste streams 
- **Corporations**: Entities seeking verifiable sustainability credits and recycled materials 
- **Local Communities**: Beneficiaries of cleaner environment and economic development
---
## **Problem Statement**  

### **Environmental Crisis**
Africa generates 17 million tons of plastic waste annually, and the continent hosts the world's largest e-waste dumping grounds. Despite this, only 4% of waste is recycled, and informal waste collection remains unstandardized and unverified.

- **Plastic waste**: 17 million tons annually  
- **E-waste**: Over 2.9 million tons annually  
- **Recycling rate**: Only 4% of waste is recycled  

### **Economic Challenges**   
- **Uncontrolled Dumpsites**: Over 90% of waste is disposed of in unmanaged landfills  
- **Low Earnings for Waste Collectors**: Informal workers earn less than $2/day despite their essential role  
- **Financial Exclusion**: 57% of Africa’s populationlacks access to formal financial systems, limiting economic opportunities

### **Technological Gaps**   
- Limited traceability in waste management  
- Lack of verification for recycling claims  
- Inefficient payment systems for informal collectors  
- Disconnected stakeholders across the waste value chain
---
## **Solution: AfriCycle’s Innovation**  

AfriCycle combines blockchain technology and Regenerative Finance (ReFi) principles to create a transparent, efficient, and scalable waste management ecosystem. Here's how AfriCycle solves the problem:

### **Key Features & Benefits**

- **Tokenized Incentives for Collectors**:  
  Waste collectors earn stable coin (cUSD) rewards for every verified waste collection, promoting financial inclusion and fair compensation.

- **Blockchain-Verified Recycling**:  
  Every waste collection and recycling activity is tracked and verified on the blockchain, providing full transparency and eliminating fraud in the recycling process.

- **Sustainability for Corporations**:  
  AfriCycle provides businesses with verified recycling credits that help them meet sustainability goals and earn carbon offset credits, improving their green credentials.

- **Streamlined Supply Chain**:  
  By connecting waste collectors, recycling facilities, and corporations, AfriCycle creates an efficient and transparent supply chain, reducing inefficiencies and fostering a circular economy.

- **Environmental Impact**:  
  AfriCycle helps reduce waste in landfills, mitigates pollution, and ensures proper recycling, contributing to healthier, cleaner environments across Africa.
---
## **Conclusion**  
AfriCycle is a holistic solution to Africa’s waste management challenges. By integrating blockchain technology with financial incentives and circular economy principles, AfriCycle offers a scalable, sustainable solution that has the potential to disrupt the waste management industry. With a focus on transparency, verification, and financial inclusion, AfriCycle is poised to create long-term environmental, social, and economic value across Africa.

project.title: Rifai Sicilia
project.description:
# Rifai Sicilia: Regenerating Sicily's Bioregional Economy

## Mission

Rifai Sicilia is a cultural association dedicated to regenerating Sicily's ecology by fostering a thriving bioregional economy. We unite regional projects and initiatives, leveraging culture and technology as transformative tools to revalue our territory. As part of the ReFi Italia family and ReFi DAO network we are working to develop best onchain regenerative practices in our local ecological context while learning and sharing with other nodes around the world.

## Vision

Our goal is to make Sicily a beacon for the Mediterranean and beyond, showcasing how regenerative bioregional cultures can flourish using blockchain technologies. Through our "rebioregionaling" process, we aim to reforest and rehydrate the landscape while restoring all eight forms of capital and integrating it into a healthy circular regenerative economy.

## Key Initiatives

- Syntropic Agroforestry
- Permaculture Education and Training
- Reforestation and Rainwater Retention
- Wildfire Prevention and Trash Cleanup
- River Health Monitoring 
- Seed Saving
- Cultural Heritage Preservation
- Agrotourism and Holistic Grazing
- Local Farmers Markets
- Mutual Credit Commitment Pooling
- Web3 Education and Onboarding

## Funding Priorities

1. Educational Events: Continued online and in-person training in permaculture, syntropic agroforestry, rainwater harvesting, forest fire prevention, and holistic grazing.
2. Tree and Seed Stock: Acquisition of certified cultivars of fruit and nut trees.
3. Commons Tool Library: Investment in shared equipment (excavator, chipper-mulcher, tractor, greenhouses) to support farms transitioning to regenerative practices.

## Impact Assessment

We employ various tools and methods to measure our impact:

- Silvi App: Tracking tree planting and growth across member sites
- Mego Tickets: Monitoring participation in mutual aid and education events
- Grassroots Economics: Developing mutual credit currencies to support regenerative efforts
- Bloom Network: Publishing impact reports linked to Karma Gap
- Soil Science Workshops: Tracking soil quality health on partner farm sites
- Atlantis App: Collaborating for river quality monitoring
- Hypercerts: Minting verified ecological impact
- Basin: Launch nature token on Zora.

## Recent Achievements (Since Previous Funding Round)

- Onboarded 4 more partner farms to Silvi App
- Added 3 new mutual credit vouchers to our commitment pool
- Deployed adopt.rifaisicilia.com to financially support tree plantings in the region
- Planted 1,000 trees at our demonstration syntropic agroforestry site
- Constructed our Charmverse knowledge repository dao.rifaisicilia.com
- Hosting monthly online member meetings
- Helped to found ReFi Mediterranean group

Our full impact profile can be found here: https://gap.karmahq.xyz/project/rifai-sicilia

Our initiatives demonstrate a clear commitment to ecological regeneration, community empowerment, and sustainable economic practices. 

With continued support, we aim to expand our impact and solidify Sicily's position as a model for bioregional regeneration.

project.title: Earthist Seeds for Regeneration
project.description:
Earthist is a community-driven initiative founded in 2019, dedicated to regeneration and public welfare in harmony with nature. 
We operate as a decentralized network of practitioners, researchers, farmers, and community members united by a shared commitment to Earth's regeneration. 
Our approach integrates indigenous wisdom with modern ecological practices, developing locally-adapted solutions with global relevance from our base in Turkiye.

#### Mission: 
After years of witnessing the escalating metacrisis, we recognize the urgent need for proactive transformation. Our mission is to empower communities and build resilient ecosystems supported by data and accessible investment pathways.
We leverage DAO (Decentralized Autonomous Organization) tools for decision-making in our ecological projects and help communities establish regenerative businesses, ecosystem health and local wellbeing. 
We are working to incorporate innovative technologies like Ecocredit Modules, Hypercerts, and Impact Miner to provide the tools needed for creating regenerative economic models for a global shift toward regeneration.

#### Our Key Projects

**"For the Earth"**
A comprehensive ecological education program fostering environmental awareness and action across communities. Through immersive learning experiences, we cultivate deep ecological literacy and connection.

**"Kendir Hemp"**
In collaboration with Kendir Agricultural Research, this flagship project supports seed sovereignty by preserving heirloom hemp seeds. We're establishing a regenerative farm with hemp cultivation and a processing center to strengthen the hemp supply chain for small and family-run farms.

**"Regenerative Cotton Project"**
In partnership with Hasat Cooperative and Raddis Cotton, we're transforming conventional cotton cultivation into regenerative systems. Through integrated practices including cover cropping, minimal tillage, and biological inputs, we rebuild soil health in fields traditionally depleted by conventional methods. Our participatory research with cotton farmers develops locally-adapted protocols that improve both yields and ecosystem function.

**"Rebioca"**
Rebioca converts organic waste into regenerative resources through advanced composting and bioconversion techniques. This initiative creates significant value from previously discarded materials, establishing circular resource flows that mimic natural systems.

**"Istanbul Hub"**
The Istanbul Hub connects farmers, researchers, and community members in developing regenerative strategies for urban and rural environments. This physical space serves as a living laboratory for ecological innovation, facilitating knowledge exchange between diverse stakeholders.

**"Orman İyeleri (Forest Schools)"**
Our Orman İyeleri program provides immersive ecological education that integrates indigenous wisdom with modern science. These forest schools cultivate a new generation of ecological practitioners who understand natural systems through direct experience.

**"Urban Gardening Programs"**
Our Urban Gardening Programs transform city spaces into productive food landscapes through community gardens, rooftop cultivation, and balcony growing systems. These initiatives reconnect urban residents with food production while creating habitat for pollinators and wildlife.

**"Web3 Education Programs"**
Our Web3 Education Programs develop digital tools for ecological tracking and transparent environmental restoration. These initiatives bridge technology and regenerative practices, creating accessible pathways for broader participation in ecosystem healing.

---

##### Recent progress and continued efforts in the past years(ongoing to previous);

✅ Live on [$REGEN Validator](https://www.mintscan.io/regen/validators/regenvaloper1wexza7kxc8qktxqcwrt65anwuxjw8pg0akx36t) to support and secure the [Regen Network](https://www.regen.network) for decentralization, aiming to enhance global ecological decision-making. [You can now stake with us](https://wallet.keplr.app/chains/regen?modal=staking&chain=regen-1&validator_address=regenvaloper1wexza7kxc8qktxqcwrt65anwuxjw8pg0akx36t&step_id=2) to support [high-quality ecological projects worldwide.](https://guides.regen.network/guides/regen-marketplace/ecocredits)

✅ Launched [Bloom Network Turkiye](https://bloomnetwork.earth/turkiye) chapter

✅ Updates on [karmagap](https://gap.karmahq.xyz/project/earthist-seeds-for-regeneration) and [charmverse](https://app.charmverse.io/earthist-seeds)

✅ Working with Inverter Network to create a regenerative ecosystem in our bioregion

✅ Our community has established three NGOs: [farmer cooperative](www.hasat.org),  [medical cannabis awareness](https://www.keyar.org.tr) and promoting [Forest Schools to foster ecological awareness among children and adults](https://www.instagram.com/ormaniyeleri?igsh=bThlaWQ3aXJuOTk=)

✅ Hosted over 33 community events and [unique regen workshops](https://twitter.com/earthistdao/status/1763209350452048230?t=x6HQSWZFm_sAig9OYbQ0wg&s=19)

✅ Creating hypercerts on CELO and Optimism for EBF-focused community projects and workshops.

✅ We have initiated work and research on blending Ahimsa (non-violent) silk with hemp fiber. These efforts aim to further enhance our supply chain's value through innovative material integration.

✅ Developing an impact oracle to track ecological impact and regen workshops for our communities.

✅ Launched a [Earthist Quadratic Funding Round](https://mirror.xyz/earthist.eth/QMmPos14uC1epQaW-2lJRz1tXnTGl01nSva1HGFzyzM) for community contributors

---
#### Vision: 
*We cultivate living systems that restore ecosystem vitality, transforming human interactions with the natural world from sources of environmental depletion to powerful mechanisms of ecological renewal. Our work spans agriculture, technology, education, and community development, creating regenerative pathways that heal and reconnect human and ecological networks.*

✅ Launched a [Earthist Quadratic Funding Round](https://mirror.xyz/earthist.eth/QMmPos14uC1epQaW-2lJRz1tXnTGl01nSva1HGFzyzM) for community contributors

---
#### Vision: 
*We cultivate living systems that restore ecosystem vitality, transforming human interactions with the natural world from sources of environmental depletion to powerful mechanisms of ecological renewal. Our work spans agriculture, technology, education, and community development, creating regenerative pathways that heal and reconnect human and ecological networks.*

metadata.title: Jabali - an intergenerational care home
metadata.description:
## Masseria Jabali: A Holistic Solution for Social and Ecological Regeneration

**Let’s build solutions for community and ecological renewal –**  
Masseria Jabali - An Intergenerational Care Home in the South of Italy

Located in the heart of Puglia, Italy, Masseria Jabali is more than a luxury elder care retreat—it’s a mission-driven project blending dignified senior living with social impact and ecological regeneration. We’re creating a space where the elderly can thrive, refugees find opportunity, and the Salento community grows stronger.

Traditional elder care often overlooks the bigger picture: community well-being and environmental health. Masseria Jabali changes that. By employing and training English speaking refugees, supporting local economies, and prioritizing regeneration, we deliver high-quality care for seniors with dementia while creating rural jobs in the  region. This isn’t just a care home—it’s a regenerators’ hub, fostering hope, connection, and renewal.

With your support, we’re taking this vision to the next level. Funds from this round will refine our strategy and spark community engagement, proving that elder care can be a catalyst for broader good.

---

### What We’re Building

Masseria Jabali combines rustic Italian charm with purpose:  
- **Care with Dignity**: Private rooms and 24/7 personalized support for seniors with dementia, including medication reminders, meal assistance, and a clean, safe environment—because they can’t live unsupervised anymore.  
- **Social Impact**: Jobs and training for refugees, integrating them into the workforce and enriching our community with diverse perspectives.  
- **Ecological Renewal**: Solar power, water recycling, and fresh food from our syntropic farm.  
- **Local Boost**: Engagement with Salento’s farmers, artisans, and businesses to rivitalize the regional economy.  

Our current working business plan is live [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1EsvW0A00MakukiSitNEbvnUMku3SYY9uX56jQkBvwsI/edit?usp=sharing)—a foundation we’re ready to polish and expand.

---

### Why This Matters

Elder care can do more than meet basic needs—it can regenerate communities and landscapes. Too often, facilities focus solely on profit or bare-minimum services, ignoring the potential for wider impact. We see a different path: a retreat that heals people *and* places. By weaving together senior care, refugee empowerment, and green practices, we’re testing a model that others can follow.  

This funding round is our chance to prove it works—and share the blueprint with Salento’s regenerators.

---

### How We’ll Use the Funds

We’re not just dreaming big—we’re planning smart. Here’s how we’ll put your contributions to work over the next few months:

#### Phase 1: Refine the Vision (Business Plan Development)  
- **Goal**: Create a polished, submittable business plan to unlock EU and regional grants for Masseria Jabali’s growth.  
- **What We’ll Do**:  
  - Hire experts in grant writing and elder care policy to enhance our [current plan](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1EsvW0A00MakukiSitNEbvnUMku3SYY9uX56jQkBvwsI/edit?usp=sharing).  
  - Add detailed financial projections, impact metrics (e.g., jobs created, carbon reduced), and a roadmap for scaling our refugee integration and sustainability efforts.  
  - Tailor the plan to specific EU programs (e.g., Horizon Europe, Puglia Regional Development Funds) with clear eligibility criteria met.  
- **Outcome**: A professional, grant-ready document that secures funding to build out our retreat and amplify its impact.

#### Phase 2: Engage the Community (Lecce Event)  
- **Goal**: Host a 1-day event in Lecce, Italy, for 20–35 locals passionate about regeneration, teaching them how to turn ideas into funded projects.  
- **Format**:  
  - **Morning Session**: “Imagining Regeneration in Salento”  
    - Interactive discussion led by Masseria Jabali founders on what renewal looks like—restored land, thriving communities, and inclusive economies.  
    - Guest speakers: a representative of [GUS](https://www.gus-italia.org/).  
  - **Afternoon Workshop**: “Writing a Winning Business Plan”  
    - Hands-on training with grant experts on crafting professional plans for EU and regional funding.  
    - Focus on practical steps: defining goals, budgeting, and measuring impact.  
    - Participants draft mini-plans for their own regeneration ideas (e.g., eco-tourism, community gardens).  
  - **Evening Wrap-Up**: Networking dinner with attendees, speakers, and Masseria Jabali staff to build a regenerators’ network.  
- **Outcome**: Empowered locals with the tools to launch their own projects, plus a stronger community connection to Masseria Jabali’s mission.

---

### Key Deliverables

1. **A Robust Business Plan**:  
   - A comprehensive, grant-eligible document ready for EU and regional submissions by August 2025.  
   - Includes detailed strategies for elder care, refugee integration, and ecological goals, backed by data and stakeholder input.  

2. **A Community Event**:  
   - A successful Lecce gathering with 20–35 attendees, sparking regeneration ideas and equipping participants with business planning skills.  
   - Follow-up report shared with Gitcoin backers: attendance stats, participant feedback, and next steps for Salento’s regenerators.

---

### Why Back Us?

We’re showing how elder care can lift up overlooked groups, heal the environment, and inspire a region. Your support doesn’t just fund a retreat center for the elderly; it fuels a ripple effect of good.  

- **For Seniors**: A tangible solution to the elderly care crisis;
- **For Refugees**: A tangible solution to the refugee integration crisis happening throughout Europe.
- **For Salento**:    ~ One organization with the potential to create hundreds of caretakers that will work in the region and lead stable lives with healthcare professions.
   ~ For the abandoned ulivetti and vineyards of Salento that need TLC to adapt for the desertification of the Mediterannean brought upon by climate change.
- **For You**: A chance to back a Web3-aligned vision where impact meets innovation.

---

### The Bigger Picture

This is our first step toward a replicable model. A refined business plan and a community event will unlock grants for land purchasing to fully build Masseria Jabali—then we’ll share our learnings. Imagine similar retreats across Europe, each a hub of care and regeneration. That’s the protopian future we’re hacking toward, one Puglia sunrise at a time.

---

### Fine Print

- **Timeline**: 3–6 months from funding to deliverables (plan by month 3, event by month 6).  
- **Who We Need**: Backers who care about social impact, sustainability, and community-driven solutions. This isn’t a quick flip—it’s a thoughtful build.  
- **Contact**: @regenagvocate on Twitter or check our informational website (coming soon) @ jabali.it

project.title: Eternal Forest
project.description:
Eternal Forest creates 1,000 forest sanctuaries through art and biodiversity stewarded by local communities and protected for 1,000 years. 
The project supports communities to restore and protect biodiversity habitats, by bringing together art and regeneration, creating legacy to stand for centuries.
Our mission is to create artistically designed forest sanctuaries—places where humans and wildlife can coexist, thrive, and leave a lasting natural and cultural legacy. 

How: Eternal Forest sanctuary is created through art-science  residencies, artistic trails and interventions connecting communities to their natural environment as stewards responsible for the future forest sanctuary. 

Partners: Eternal Forest collaborates with land-based projects, eco-resorts, local governments and land trusts, growing a movement of artists, scientists, cultural organisations, tree-planting and conservation initiatives, foundations and land partners.

The movement of land regeneration is growing and we are teaming up with communities and projects that commit to long-term land stewardship. We are in conversation with 10 land projects in Portugal, France, Spain, and Romania joining the Eternal Forest network at this stage. Communities are seeking a shared vision, practical tools, and guidance to protect and regenerate forests. 

From our primary cohort of 4 projects in northern Portugal, we're creating inter-supportive networks, tenderly restoring native ecosystems while honouring local traditions and stories. In Portugal, we are working with a local Municipality, reforestation and conservation projects, a wellness retreat centre and artist residencies. 

Our process is focused on identifying communities and projects for future forest sanctuaries, helping to create a local consortium of aligned partners, with clear strategy, timelines and funding, co-create a forest sanctuary with an ongoing cultural and artistic program.

Each tree planted is a promise to the future, each protected hectare a gift to our grandchildren's grandchildren, each community connected to their forest is a guarantee of this forest standing for the long-term.

With your help, we can establish a mutually supportive network of Eternal Forest sanctuaries, creating places of beauty, reflection, and regeneration.

With your support, we will:
Create forest sanctuaries in collaboration with our land-based partner projects
Share forest stewardship wisdom with local communities
Preserve precious ecological knowledge
Create forest art in collaboration with nature and people
Build a dedicated team and advisory council
Create legal guardianship for these sacred spaces

Join our circle of forest guardians and help us rebuild the sacred bridge between humanity and nature—a loving connection that will flourish over one thousand years.

project.title: Liminal Village
project.description:
Founded in 2018, Liminal Village is a living laboratory for a new civilization. Nestled in the Tronto Valley of central Italy, it is a co-living, co-creation, and eco-tech hub where individuals and communities come together to prototype a regenerative future. The name “Liminal”—meaning threshold—reflects our purpose: to inhabit and navigate the space between worlds, dissolving outdated boundaries between nature and technology, self and society, matter and spirit.

At Liminal, we invite changemakers, visionaries, and grounded practitioners to step beyond inherited paradigms and co-create the systems of tomorrow—web3-enabled, community-powered, and deeply rooted in the living earth.

⸻

Vision & Mission

Our vision is to catalyze a thriving, interconnected network of regenerative communities, each contributing uniquely to a new global eco-civilization. Liminal Village stands as a beacon for this movement—demonstrating how societies can function beyond extractive economies, embracing technologies and practices that honor both life and complexity.

Our mission is to heal and transform both individuals and collectives by aligning personal, local, and planetary needs. We cultivate temporary yet intentional communities that challenge norms and model new rhythms of life—inviting participants to co-design how we live, work, learn, and care together. Through immersive experiences, educational programs, and tech-integrated ecosystems, we aim to shift society’s foundation from scarcity to shared abundance, and from separation to conscious interdependence.

project.title: ReFi Italia
project.description:
ReFi Italia is a network-driven initiative dedicated to tackle ecological and social challenges through innovative technology and grassroots initiatives. Over the past few years, we've focused on building the foundational infrastructure for regenerative development across Italian bioregions. Our vision for 2025 and beyond is to amplify our achievements through focused education, strategic network expansion, and tangible ecological restoration projects, creating a blueprint for similar Mediterranean regions.  
  
# Focus areas  
  
## Education and Outreach  
  
We work to raise awareness about regenerative practices, blockchain technology, and community-led development. By educating diverse audiences, we foster a shared understanding of the challenges and opportunities shaping Italy’s ecosystems.  
  
_Recent Highlights:_
- Hosted two online workshops on mutual credit protocols, featuring [Grassroots Economics](https://www.grassrootseconomics.org/) and [Cycles.money](https://x.com/cyclesmoney).  
- Led an in-person training session on commitment pooling during [Rifai Sicilia](https://x.com/RifaiSicilia) Week.  
- Participated in key Italian web3 events, including [ETHNA](https://x.com/ethna_rocks), [ETHRome](https://x.com/ETHRome), [Digitalia Pilot](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=obsXeGs-cJs&ab_channel=UrbeETH), and [Apical Days Palermo](https://www.instagram.com/apical_org/p/DBi5QpLsUyd/).  
  
## Community Empowerment  
  
Empowering local communities is at the core of ReFi Italia's approach to regeneration. We facilitate collaboration, leadership, and decision-making among existing networks, fostering self-sufficiency and resilience. Through community-led initiatives, we build social capital and empower collective action.  
  
_Recent Highlights:_  
- In partnership with Rifai Sicilia and Grassroots Economics, we launched a mutual credit [pilot project](https://sarafu.network/pools/0xb792Ea4BBd378a03463a05A8A91bbBfD0Acd5687), exploring alternative economic models to support local resilience and community-driven economic development.  
  
## Ecological Development  
  
We promote ecosystems restoration, biodiversity protection, and sustainable land-use practices by providing resources, knowledge and capital to local regenerative projects that create impact on-the-ground.  
  
_Recent Highlights:_ 
In 2024, we sponsored a [Permaculture Design Course](https://www.instagram.com/associazioneboscoangimbe/p/DFcpyptu3dC/) at Bosco Angimbè (Trapani), training 22 participants in advanced ecological practices. The program directly contributed to ecosystem restoration with 60 supporting plant species introduced and 30 tree planted by participants of the course in collaboration with local ecological experts to ensure the preservation of native ecosystem characteristics.  
  
# 2025 Strategic Objectives  
  
## Expanding Education & Capacity Building  
  
In 2025, we’ll enhance both digital and in-person educational resources, develop specialized training programs for different community sectors, and create accessible content on regenerative practices to broaden our impact.  
  
## Strengthening the Network  
  
We aim to deepen connections with the global ReFi/Web3 ecosystem and Italian ReFi nodes, support grassroots initiatives across multiple regions, and build leadership programs that empower communities to drive regenerative change.

project.title: Zazelenimo
project.description:
Zazelenimo (eng. "let's make it green") is an **open-source web platform** designed to modernize how cities handle **participatory budgeting**, starting with urban greening initiatives in Split. It addresses the reliance of public institutions on outdated, proprietary tools by offering a solution built on **Ethereum** and leveraging **Quadratic Funding (QF)**.

**Key Features & Value:**

- **Empowers Community:** Enables citizens, NGOs, and businesses to propose, discuss, and fund local greening projects.
- **Democratic Funding:** Utilizes QF to allocate resources based on the breadth of community support, not just the size of individual contributions.
- **Web3 Integration:** Leverages Ethereum for secure digital identity (via passkey wallets with Cometh Connect), transparent transactions (via Allo Protocol), and interoperability.
- **End-to-End Solution:** Supports the entire project lifecycle from idea submission through implementation and maintenance planning.
- **Multi-Stakeholder Collaboration:** Facilitates cooperation between residents, businesses, NGOs, and municipal entities.
- **Onboarding Cities & Citizens to Ethereum:** Introduces _cities_ to the practical benefits of Ethereum, while seamlessly onboarding _citizens_ with accounts and the ability to use them, abstracting away blockchain complexities.

Our mission is to enhance **civic engagement** and **public goods funding** by providing transparent, effective, and open-source tools for stronger communities and democracies.

It is built and maintained by [Muqa](https://muga.org)

answers.answer: Ecofrontiers is a privately-run, two-person agency and is a SARL based in Provence, France. It has no investors and its revenues come from service-based work for clients in the climate and crypto sectors. Learn more at https://ecofrontiers.xyz/  Previously, prior to the spinout of the Regen Atlas, Ecofrontiers received $1576.30 in grant funding for developing the Regen Atlas’ initial prototype (see Gitcoin checker: https://checker.gitcoin.co/public/project/show/ecofrontiers-crypto-natural-capital-aggregator). This is the only grant funding to date Ecofrontiers has collected to date for its work.

project.title: Ecofrontiers: Open ReFi Research
project.description:
### **Project Description**

Ecofrontiers is a Web3 research and advocacy organization dedicated to unlocking the value of nature. As a French SARL based on the Mediterranean coast, Ecofrontiers is embedded in the region’s ReFi ecosystem. We are one of the founding members of **ReFi Provence**, a community led by Alejandra Verde that works to expand the reach of ReFi initiatives across Provence and beyond.

Ecofrontiers is writing the [Green Crypto Handbook](https://cosmic-move-29b.notion.site/The-Green-Crypto-Handbook-10c874bd4c32803e8494eebd005cc303?pvs=4), a 350-page research and advocacy effort to shape the future of green crypto asset design. The Handbook highlights practical solutions for leveraging blockchain technology to produce and scale **natural capital and green crypto-assets**, and aims to **educate policymakers, impact investors, and ReFi entrepreneurs** on the opportunities of Web3 for ecological impact.

We’ve published three sample chapters accessible to all for free on Mirror: 
- [Protocol Layer: How Institutions Structure Their Networks](https://mirror.xyz/ecofrontiers.eth/sutitG7HsFz74mwXUokmo11GQtjM5GpGFzHAlbaww-o)
- [Asset Layer: The Market Object of Protocols](https://mirror.xyz/ecofrontiers.eth/zkh2LoADInAgr7GLbXnsuUOEcwJKFE4GuUSYuYU22io)
- [Market Layer: Thriving in the Open Liquidity Environment](https://mirror.xyz/ecofrontiers.eth/z53KLf1agwjNSQrAY78Zg4qm9-FYZB2Yh3TDj3ojIRM)

In the past, we also have conducted **research that is more specific to the Mediterranean bioregion**, including a cryptoeconomic framework for the protection and regeneration of **Posidonia Oceanica meadows and reefs**, a keystone species crucial for coastal biodiversity and carbon sequestration:

- [The Cryptoeconomic Neptune](https://blog.curvelabs.eu/the-cryptoeconomic-neptune-a96e3d7d9ff3)
- [New Breath in the Mediterranean](https://medium.com/curve-labs/new-breath-in-the-mediterranean-35d881d094ae)

[View project on KarmaGAP](https://gap.karmahq.xyz/project/ecofrontiers)

### **Grant Purpose & Outputs**

With support from this grant, we will:

- **Advance the Green Crypto Handbook**: Conduct editorial work to finalize and publish the book, making it a key resource for policymakers and ReFi practitioners. As of today, we are on the last chapter.
- **Support the Growth of ReFi Provence**: Expand outreach, education, and participate in local ReFi events to connect more Mediterranean regenerative projects with Web3 opportunities.

### **Resources**

📚 [Website](https://ecofrontiers.xyz/)
📝 [Blog](https://mirror.xyz/ecofrontiers.eth)
🐦 [X](https://x.com/ecofrontiers)

- **Support the Growth of ReFi Provence**: Expand outreach, education, and participate in local ReFi events to connect more Mediterranean regenerative projects with Web3 opportunities.

### **Resources**

📚 [Website](https://ecofrontiers.xyz/)
📝 [Blog](https://mirror.xyz/ecofrontiers.eth)
🐦 [X](https://x.com/ecofrontiers)

project.title: ReFi Barcelona
project.description:
## **A Local Node as a Rooted Cooperative  🌱**

[**ReFi Barcelona**](https://refibcn.cat/Home_CAT) is a local node within the global [**ReFi movement**](https://refibcn.cat/Ecosystem+Map/Global+-+ReFi+and+Web3/ReFi+Ecosystem), focused on connecting **regenerative finance, local regenerators and the Social & Solidarity Economy (ESS)** in Barcelona and across Catalonia - to drive forward the so called **[ecosocial transition](https://www.bcn.coop/transicio-ecosocial/).**

We’re also part of a broader bioregional effort through [**ReFi Mediterranean**](https://www.regencoordination.xyz/refi-mediterranean-gg23), where we collaborate with other nodes across the bioregion to scale regenerative strategies and funding mechanisms for regenerative work.

> We serve as a bridge between global Web3 infrastructure and place-based economic transformation.
> 

### Our Approach: Building Hybrid Systems Through Cooperative Structures **🌍**

ReFi Barcelona is a **proof of concept** for building regenerative systems that are both **technologically innovative and socially grounded**.

We believe that to regenerate economies, we need **hybrid infrastructures** that:

- **Leverage Web3** for transparency, coordination, and composability; as well as for opening opportunities for funding and support
- **Integrate cooperative models** for human-scale governance and economic justice
- **Learn from local territories**, while staying globally connected

### Our plan: Growing from the roots of cooperativism 🌲

To build systems that work beyond theory, we need **real-world grounding**.

That’s why ReFi BCN is based at [**Bloc4**](https://bloc4.coop/), Europe’s largest cooperative innovation hub — home to more than 40 cooperatives and social enterprises. Bloc4 provides:

- Access to **funding channels beyond Web3** (public & cooperative finance)
- **Mentorship and training** in governance, sustainability and viability
- Daily exposure to the **needs, tools and culture** of ESS actors
- Incubation from Bloc4/Coòpolis, Barcelona's cooperative development agency

> Bloc4 amplifies our ability to design, test and share
> 
> 
> **hybrid regenerative models with the local Social & Solidarity Economy.**
> 

![image.png](https://file.notion.so/f/f/98673c04-e3cf-4b0a-8f3c-a85c8332f21e/a19384a8-35f8-46d0-b142-acbaeef51911/New_Draft_Image.png?table=block&id=1c86ed08-45cb-808a-bc32-f89393d277a5&spaceId=98673c04-e3cf-4b0a-8f3c-a85c8332f21e&expirationTimestamp=1743616800000&signature=Cghq6RBqD1P8zGTv712jfQ4SdR_II1VTHm398sLtUlE&downloadName=New+Draft+Image.png)

![photo_2025-03-27 13.53.32.jpeg](https://file.notion.so/f/f/98673c04-e3cf-4b0a-8f3c-a85c8332f21e/09458670-9d1e-4f73-b6a3-abee709f28f9/New_Draft_Photo_Mar_27_2025.jpeg?table=block&id=1c86ed08-45cb-801a-929b-d114ed900336&spaceId=98673c04-e3cf-4b0a-8f3c-a85c8332f21e&expirationTimestamp=1743616800000&signature=Yls5cDU8H6LB1xGoVBPQwxH35YMKv0MYX0XvYGyd7gM&downloadName=New+Draft+Photo+Mar+27+2025.jpeg)

## The strategic lines we are building 🎍

We’ve identified the following key strategic lines of work to support the work of local regenerators. These pillars guide our activities and shape our approach to supporting the ecosocial transition.

Our strategic lines are designed as a progression, from building awareness to enabling action:

1. **📚 Knowledge, Research & Education** — *From unawareness to understanding*
    
    We develop open knowledge and its repositories, materials, and practical guides that make regenerative concepts accessible to diverse audiences, with special attention to connecting global ReFi innovations with local contexts and needs, and vice versa.
    
    - [ReFi BCN Knowledge Base](https://refibcn.cat/Ecosystem+Map/Ecosystem+Map)

2. **👥 Community & Network** — *From understanding to collaboration*
    
    We organize events and spaces for connection, dialogue, and mutual learning between local and global actors.
    
    - ReFi Unconference Barcelona ‘24
    - BioFi Barcelona ‘25

3. **♻️ Financial Resources** — *From collaboration to supporting tangible impact*
    
    We aim to help local projects access regenerative funding through Web3 platforms and ethical banking in the Social & Solidarity economy, exploring how to create hybrid financial structures to support the much-needed regenerative work on the ground.
    
    - Piloting with the ReFi Mediterranean GG23 round

4. **⚖️ Governance & Innovation** — *From consolidation to systemic transformation (future)*
    
    On the horizon, we’d like to promote governance approaches that combine cooperative principles with DAOs, exploring different models to fund and develop local communities—such as democratic decision-making, established financial flows, quadratic funding, community currencies, and more. This pillar will activate in a future phase as the network strengthens.
    

---

# 2. What we are currently working on **🌿**

### 🫂 Cooperative Constitution

- First ReFi node to register as a legally recognized **workers cooperative (SCCL)**
- Incubated by [**Coòpolis**](https://www.bcn.coop/), Barcelona’s cooperative incubator
- We’re undergoing official training, forming bylaws, and building viable economic plans — with oversight from the most respected cooperative actors in Catalonia.
- Laying the legal and economic foundation for ReFi BCN infrastructure
- Establishing a practical model for ReFi nodes to integrate with local economic structures

### 🌍 Upcoming *BioFi Barcelona* Event in May 2025

- Flagship event on **Bioregional Finance in Barcelona**
- Organized in collaboration with the Commons Agency; hosted at Bloc4 with
- Bringing ecological thinking into financial infrastructure

### 🌊 ReFi Mediterranean: Bioregional Coordination in Action

ReFi BCN is playing a foundational role in building **ReFi Mediterranean**, a bioregional collaboration hub across the bioregion.

We are:

- Co-creating a **shared regenerative plan** for the Mediterranean
- Piloting **Gitcoin rounds** to fund **local regenerators**
- Onboarding projects into **GG23** and beyond

---

# 3. What we’ve done so far 🌾

### 🗺️ Ecosystem Map & Knowledge Base

![Gitcoin Explorer (1).webp](https://file.notion.so/f/f/98673c04-e3cf-4b0a-8f3c-a85c8332f21e/1314987e-4370-45e1-8f32-2278ac2ed726/Gitcoin_Explorer_(1)_(1).webp?table=block&id=1c86ed08-45cb-80e1-8279-d4edad118255&spaceId=98673c04-e3cf-4b0a-8f3c-a85c8332f21e&expirationTimestamp=1743616800000&signature=bI0n7QQm7-dDPDfIlP1mm1_1dI2sy8N1O6hPGAZ5iC8&downloadName=Gitcoin+Explorer+(1)+(1).webp)

We've created a comprehensive research resource that maps value-aligned actors across Barcelona and Catalonia, with specific focus on:

- Social & Solidarity Economy organizations
- Web3 and ReFi projects
- Regenerative practitioners and initiatives

The knowledge base serves as a foundation for our work by documenting the existing ecosystem and identifying potential bridges between communities.

> This knowledge base is a living research tool — not just for us, but for any one to explore, expand and build upon.
> 

Check-out the ecosystem map & knowledge base → [**https://ReFiBCN.cat**](https://refibcn.cat/)

### 🌱 ReFi Unconference Barcelona 2024

![Línea de Tiempo Para Negocio Degradado Llamativo Moderno Colorido Azul Lila Negro (3).png](https://file.notion.so/f/f/98673c04-e3cf-4b0a-8f3c-a85c8332f21e/94a648e7-4d5e-4356-bdbb-7f8088f9c681/Modern_Colorful_Timeline_Draft.png?table=block&id=1c86ed08-45cb-801d-80bb-e71791592d8c&spaceId=98673c04-e3cf-4b0a-8f3c-a85c8332f21e&expirationTimestamp=1743616800000&signature=hd7ZBOibpxTg4S2KB2XF7JVzr2nPli7_noA4ciHqfg8&downloadName=Modern+Colorful+Timeline+Draft.png)

The [**ReFi Unconference Barcelona**](https://www.notion.so/c184c3edc6ef462c9e64d49985d2b63e?pvs=21), organized by ReFi Barcelona local node in collaboration with the Crypto Commons Association and Trusted Seed, brought together relevant local projects focused on the Eco-Social Transition with key stakeholders from the global ReFi ecosystem.

- 40+ stakeholders and 30+ sessions from the ReFi and related ecosystems
- 🎥 [Watch the sessions](https://www.notion.so/0ad80a7c87994ef2b7e820057ec842ef?pvs=21) and check the resources

---

# 4. Who we are 👤

![Luizfernandolfsg 1024.jpg](https://file.notion.so/f/f/98673c04-e3cf-4b0a-8f3c-a85c8332f21e/91b34598-600e-487a-aa2a-d518106b7cc6/New_Draft_Luizfernandolfsg_1024.jpg?table=block&id=1c86ed08-45cb-8052-9af3-d52970a9518c&spaceId=98673c04-e3cf-4b0a-8f3c-a85c8332f21e&expirationTimestamp=1743616800000&signature=13QCJJbCqDVj8rFMc5txN6c8pKrOHRWt-CAMII9gngM&downloadName=New+Draft+Luizfernandolfsg+1024.jpg)

**Luiz Fernando Gomez Segala** — Founder & Lead

- Core Steward and Operations Lead at **ReFi DAO**
- Steward (Gardener) at Trusted Seed

→ [Twitter](https://twitter.com/louizfe) | [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/luizfernandosg/)

![Profile - Emilia Sierra Guzmán.jpg](https://file.notion.so/f/f/98673c04-e3cf-4b0a-8f3c-a85c8332f21e/bd988313-d19c-4474-825e-1b138094e6a3/Emilia_Sierra_Guzman_Profile.jpg?table=block&id=1c86ed08-45cb-802c-baf5-d8ca233acce3&spaceId=98673c04-e3cf-4b0a-8f3c-a85c8332f21e&expirationTimestamp=1743616800000&signature=voa9vs17b0p7zkkHH2-0R8Gx-VTiQ8JKapCUwY9tATM&downloadName=Emilia+Sierra+Guzman+Profile.jpg)

**Emilia Sierra Guzmán** — Community Lead

- Creative Director & Brand Strategist
- Innovation & Impact Strategy Consultant
- Educator and Earth Guardian

→ [Twitter](https://twitter.com/EmiliaEarth) | [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/emilia-earth-395b17171/)

ReFi BCN is to be a growing **collective of practitioners, educators, and ecosystem builders**.

---

## 🌐 Connect With Us

- Twitter → [@ReFiBCN](https://twitter.com/refibcn)
- Telegram → https://t.me/+j4zOWZGsITwxNmY8
- Email → hola@refibcn.cat

---

## 🔗 Key Partners

- **[Bloc4](https://bloc4.coop/) & [Coòpolis](https://bcn.coop/)** — Our cooperative home and incubator, anchoring us in Barcelona’s largest ecosystem of social enterprises while providing hands-on guidance and resources for establishing the cooperative.
- [**Commons Agency**](https://www.commonseconomy.org/commons-agency) — Co-organizers of the upcoming BioFi Barcelona event in May ‘25.
- [**ReFi DAO**](https://refidao.com/) — A global ReFi backbone, linking local nodes worldwide and fostering shared learning across the regenerative finance ecosystem.

project.title: ReFi PACA
project.description:
ReFi PACA is building a regional hub for Regenerative Finance in Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur (Southern France), connecting blockchain technology with ecological and social impact projects. 

We serve as a bridge between Web3 innovators, environmental initiatives, and local communities to address regional Mediterranean challenges.

Our impact goals are:

1. Ecological regeneration: Support marine and terrestrial ecosystem restoration projects by providing access to transparent funding mechanisms, tokenization of impact, and decentralized governance models.
2. Knowledge transfer: Foster cross-sector collaboration by creating educational opportunities for both tech experts to understand & contribute to solve ecological challenges and environmental, social & economic actors to leverage Web3 tools.
3. Regional resilience: Strengthen local economies through the use of decentralized currencies, impact verification systems, and regenerative economic models that value ecological assets.

4. Mediterranean coordination: Integrate with the broader ReFi Mediterranean initiative to create coordinated responses to shared bioregional challenges.

By weaving this network, we aim to catalyze at least 10 local impact projects with Web3 tools by 2026, educate 200+ individuals about regenerative finance, and establish PACA as a leader in implementing innovative solutions that align economic activities with planetary health.
